sqlMap.select: select c.catid, c.name as catname, c.descn as catdescn, p.productid, p.category, p.name as prodname, p.descn as proddescn, i.itemid, i.productid, i.listprice, i.unitcost, i.supplier, i.status, i.attr1, i.attr2, i.attr3, i.attr4, i.attr5, v.itemid, v.qty from category c, product p, item i, inventory v where c.catid = p.category and p.productid = i.productid and i.itemid = v.itemid

select c.catid, c.name as catname, c.descn as catdescn, p.productid, p.category, p.name as prodname, p.descn as proddescn, i.itemid, i.productid, i.listprice, i.unitcost, i.supplier, i.status, i.attr1, i.attr2, i.attr3, i.attr4, i.attr5, v.itemid, v.qty from category c, product p, item i, inventory v where c.catid = p.category and p.productid = i.productid and i.itemid = v.itemid

select c.catid, c.name as catname, c.descn as catdescn, p.productid, p.category, p.name as prodname, p.descn as proddescn, i.itemid, i.productid, i.listprice, i.unitcost, i.supplier, i.status, i.attr1, i.attr2, i.attr3, i.attr4, i.attr5, v.itemid, v.qty from category c, product p, item i, inventory v where c.catid = p.category and p.productid = i.productid and i.itemid = v.itemid and c.catid = 'FISH'

select c.catid, c.name as catname, c.descn as catdescn, cast(null as varchar(1)) as productid, cast(null as varchar(1)) as category, cast(null as varchar(1)) as prodname, cast(null as varchar(1)) as proddescn from category c
